entries.content:
Session started with Moti. Last session ended with roll-up animation investigation. We tried multiple approaches (transform, margin-top, spacer div) but all failed due to .message-list having position:absolute. This removes it from document flow, breaking flex-based height calculation.

Two paths identified:
1. Remove position:absolute if not required for multi-chat
2. Create NEW_INNER_WRAPPER to reconcile flex layout with absolute positioning

Next steps: Investigate why .message-list needs position:absolute, check if multi-chat requires it.

Created chat demo with sidebar layout. Chat UI on left (500px), control panel on right. Two separate buttons: "User Message" and "Simulate AI Response" for independent testing. Uses real production CSS via relative paths. Ready for animation implementation.

DECISION: Demo-first approach proved massively successful. Instead of fighting with production complexity (position:absolute, multi-chat), we built isolated demo environment. Result: 30 minutes to working animation vs multiple failed sessions in production. Key insight: When stuck in complexity, build simpler version first with real CSS but simplified structure.
